page.title: 18EDUCATION MEMORIES OF DACRE.
page.content: The original school(1749) now a cottage just below the Horse and Farrier Inn was replaced by the school building(1834) near the Castle gates,at a cost of nearly 130 pounds. The last headteacher was Miss I.Richardson appointed in December 1937 and Dacre School closed in December1965.Pupils moving to the new school in Stainton.The age range was originally 4-14 years,all pupils then worked.There was no school meals service or school transport.Heating was by coke stove and open fire - useful for drying wet coats on stormy days.If the stove did not burn well P.E. was done to create a draught.During World War 2,the school had evacuees from South Shields and extra teaching help.The village school was a "happy family"and took a full part in village life.
